guide.conclusion: Fun costume with no sewing machine needed, but you do need lots of time for hand-sewing all the parts together.

guide.introduction: With a premade body suit, the addition of some chiffon, netting and a few fabric-covered foam balls, you can have a fun Ghostbusters-themed costume that just needs a bit of makeup to tie it together.
guide.introduction_rendered:
With a premade body suit, the addition of some chiffon, netting and a few fabric-covered foam balls, you can have a fun Ghostbusters-themed costume that just needs a bit of makeup to tie it together.

Tools
  • Serrated Knife
  • needle, scissors,

steps.title: Get a body suit as the base of the costume

lines.text: This takes a lot of the hard work out of this costume - this is a formfitting outfit, and trying to sew stretchy material will be quite a challenge.
lines.text_raw: This takes a lot of the hard work out of this costume - this is a formfitting outfit, and trying to sew stretchy material will be quite a challenge.

lines.text: Try searching for ballet or dance supplies (unitard / body suit) to match your size.
lines.text_raw: Try searching for ballet or dance supplies (unitard / body suit) to match your size.

lines.text: The important part is that the body suit should completely cover your arms and legs.
lines.text_raw: The important part is that the body suit should completely cover your arms and legs.

lines.text: In the second  picture, the costume is almost complete, but this should give you an idea of the sort of body suit you're looking for to start with.
lines.text_raw: In the second  picture, the costume is almost complete, but this should give you an idea of the sort of body suit you're looking for to start with.

lines.text: Foam Balls
lines.text_raw: Foam Balls

lines.text: Usually sold as Christmas ornaments in craft stores - get a couple of different sizes ranging from 1/2" to 2" diameter.
lines.text_raw: Usually sold as Christmas ornaments in craft stores - get a couple of different sizes ranging from 1/2" to 2" diameter.

lines.text: Shiny fabric
lines.text_raw: Shiny fabric

lines.text: You want it to be metallic/glittery, and stretchy, since you'll be wrapping the foam balls with these. In this project I use silver lamé.
lines.text_raw: You want it to be metallic/glittery, and stretchy, since you'll be wrapping the foam balls with these. In this project I use '''silver lamé'''.

lines.text: Sheer fabric
lines.text_raw: Sheer fabric

lines.text: Pastel colored (iridescent for best effect). Here I used chiffon. If you can find iridescent chiffon, you may not need the multiple colors.
lines.text_raw: Pastel colored (iridescent  for best effect). Here I used '''chiffon'''. If you can find iridescent chiffon, you may not need the multiple colors.

lines.text: Light-weight netting with multiple hole sizes and color. I used a small-hole sliver metallic and a large-hole white glitter.
lines.text_raw: Light-weight netting with multiple hole sizes and color. I used a small-hole sliver metallic and a large-hole white glitter.

lines.text: Take at least 3-dozen of the foam balls, and cut them cleanly in half.
lines.text_raw: Take at least 3-dozen of the foam balls, and cut them cleanly in half.

lines.text: You might find a cutting board and serrated knife handy.
lines.text_raw: You might find a cutting board and serrated knife handy.

lines.text: BE CAREFUL. The foam can cut very easily or skitter away, and you could slip.
lines.text_raw: BE CAREFUL. The foam can cut very easily or skitter away, and you could slip.

lines.text: Use more of the smaller sized balls than the big ones - they create a better textured effect.
lines.text_raw: Use more of the smaller sized balls than the big ones - they create a better textured effect.

steps.title: Cut Fabric and Wrap the Foam Balls

lines.text: Cut the silver lamé into shapes large enough to wrap around the edges of the foam hemispheres.
lines.text_raw: Cut the silver lamé into shapes large enough to wrap around the edges of the foam hemispheres.

lines.text: The back doesn't have to be pretty - stitch the corners of the fabric to each other, pulling  it taut as you go, one corner at a time. Pull the fabric  nice and snug so that you have a smooth metallic dome.
lines.text_raw: The back doesn't have to be pretty - stitch the corners of the fabric to each other, pulling  it taut as you go, one corner at a time. Pull the fabric  nice and snug so that you have a smooth metallic dome.

lines.text: Make sure you knot your stitches really well. This is what holds the balls to the outfit and if the knots fail, the balls will fall off.
lines.text_raw: Make sure you knot your stitches really well. This is what holds the balls to the outfit and if the knots fail, the balls will fall off.

lines.text: Take some of the wrapped balls, and re-wrap them with the chiffon for some variety.
lines.text_raw: Take some of the wrapped balls, and re-wrap them with the chiffon for some variety.

steps.title: Sew silver balls to body suit

lines.text: They should follow curvy S-patterns around the entire body. Mix sizes as you go.
lines.text_raw: They should follow curvy S-patterns around the entire body. Mix sizes as you go.

lines.text: Do this on the suit as its being worn - otherwise you run the risk of binding, wrinkling or tearing the fabric when it is worn.
lines.text_raw: Do this on the suit as its being worn - otherwise you run the risk of binding, wrinkling or tearing the fabric when it is worn.

lines.text: Sew each ball individually, knot it off and move on to the next one.
lines.text_raw: Sew each ball individually, knot it off and move on to the next one.

lines.text: If you sew multiple balls in single line / stitch, the suit will probably not stretch correctly, and you'll tear it putting it on.
lines.text_raw: If you sew multiple balls in single line / stitch, the suit will probably not stretch correctly, and you'll tear it putting it on.

lines.text: Don't just sew the foam to the suit - make sure you are sewing fabric on the balls to the body suit.
lines.text_raw: Don't just sew the foam to the suit - make sure you are sewing fabric on the balls to the body suit.

lines.text: Pull up a corner of the body suit, pull the needle through the fabric and make a good knot. Now you can pull  the body suit away from the body while you sew. Pull up the body suit for every stitch so the wearer does not become a pin cushion.
lines.text_raw: Pull up a corner of the body suit, pull the needle through the fabric and make a good knot. Now you can pull  the body suit away from the body while you sew. Pull up the body suit for every stitch so the wearer does not become a pin cushion.

steps.title: Sew layers of fabrics over the suit

lines.text: The goal is to add a shimmering, ghostly texture to the entire outfit.
lines.text_raw: The goal is to add a shimmering, ghostly texture to the entire outfit.

lines.text: Interleave layers of chiffon and netting around the entire body - make sure to drape over the silver balls as you go.
lines.text_raw: Interleave layers of chiffon and netting around the entire body - make sure to drape over the silver balls as you go.

lines.text: As you go, tack down the fabric with simple stitches and knots.
lines.text_raw: As you go, tack down the fabric with simple stitches and knots.

lines.text: The fabric should be mostly form-fitting - keep it close to the body with frequent stitches/knots. It should not billow or hang.
lines.text_raw: The fabric should be mostly form-fitting - keep it close to the body with frequent stitches/knots. It should not billow or hang.

lines.text: Again, do this with the costume being worn to make sure it looks and feels right.
lines.text_raw: Again, do this with the costume being worn to make sure it looks and feels right.

lines.text: Have the wearer take off / put on the costume a few times to make sure nothing pulls or snags.
lines.text_raw: Have the wearer take off / put on the costume a few times to make sure nothing pulls or snags.

lines.text: Look for any weird or bare spaces and fill them in with additional material as you prefer.
lines.text_raw: Look for any weird or bare spaces and fill them in with additional material as you prefer.

lines.text: This costume needs some ghostly makeup to really bring it together!
lines.text_raw: This costume needs some ghostly makeup to really bring it together!

lines.text: Black eyeshadow - above the eyes and along the nose, cheekbones and forehead/temple accents.
lines.text_raw: Black eyeshadow - above the eyes and along the nose, cheekbones and forehead/temple accents.

lines.text: Light foundation, with fine powder glitter for glow.
lines.text_raw: Light foundation, with fine powder glitter for glow.

lines.text: Short, spiked hair - if you have long hair, pull it up in a ponytail and frizz the heck out of it straight up. Lots of hairspray.
lines.text_raw: Short, spiked hair - if you have long hair, pull it up in a ponytail and frizz the heck out of it straight up. Lots of hairspray.

lines.text: Red designer contacts if you like.
lines.text_raw: Red designer contacts if you like.

lines.text: Be sure to check the film for your inspiration. Dont forget that you need strut and attitude to pull it off!
lines.text_raw: Be sure to check the film for your inspiration. Dont forget that you need strut and attitude to pull it off!

guide.summary: Create a Halloween costume of the classic ghostly villain from your favorite '80s ghost movie. All from a basic body suit and a few miscellaneous materials.
guide.time_required: 5-10 hours if you're comfortable working with fabrics.
